title: Workshop on Inquiry-Based Science Learning Design and Responsive Teaching Strategies for Elementary Education

context.prior_knowledge: Familiarity with elementary science education theory and general pedagogical methods
context.additional_context: A course for pre-service and in-service teachers to learn how to effectively apply inquiry-based learning and on-the-fly scaffolding in elementary science classes. It combines theoretical lectures with practical workshops, focusing on enhancing actual lesson design capabilities.

learning_goals: Learners can apply inquiry-based instructional principles (structured inquiry and guided inquiry) to elementary science lesson design.
Learners can execute at least three on-the-fly scaffolding techniques (engagement prompting, focus prompting, problem-posing) to immediately address issues in students' inquiry processes.
Learners can design inquiry lesson plans incorporating variable control strategies using elementary science concepts like thermal insulation.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
